senses.de: To think that something will probably or certainly happen
senses.ex: I expect that she will come to the party

Tips.title: Certainty Level
Tips.description: Use 'expect' when you are quite sure about future events, but there is still some uncertainty.
Tips.example: I expect she'll finish the report by Friday.

Tips.title: Predicting Behavior
Tips.description: 'Expect' can convey belief in how people will behave based on past actions.
Tips.example: Given his punctuality, I expect Tom to be on time.

senses.de: To consider something as likely to happen
senses.ex: They expect the weather to be sunny tomorrow

Tips.title: Natural Phenomena
Tips.description: 'Expect' is commonly used for weather forecasts and natural events.
Tips.example: Meteorologists expect the storm to hit the coast tonight.

senses.de: To believe that someone should behave in a certain way
senses.ex: We expect all students to arrive on time

Tips.title: Social Expectations
Tips.description: Use 'expect' to express norms or standards people are supposed to meet.
Tips.example: Teachers expect students' homework to be submitted on time.

Tips.title: Setting Standards
Tips.description: 'Expect' implies a moral or social standard that one believes should be fulfilled.
Tips.example: Parents expect honesty from their children.

senses.de: To be pregnant and expecting the birth of a child
senses.ex: She's expecting her first child in June

Tips.title: Family Planning
Tips.description: In the context of pregnancy, 'expecting' is a polite, common term.
Tips.example: They're expecting their second child next spring.

senses.de: To be waiting for someone or something
senses.ex: A surprise awaits those who least expect it

Tips.title: Anticipatory Surprise
Tips.description: Literarily, 'expect' can describe awaiting something with a sense of surprise or disbelief.
Tips.example: He didn't expect such an extravagant gift.

Tips.title: Dramatic Reveal
Tips.description: Often used in literature or movies to heighten tension before a revelation.
Tips.example: The audience did not expect the twist at the end of the play.

Anticipate.wordDefinition:
Both anticipate and expect refer to looking forward to something, but there is a slight difference in their meanings.

Anticipate is used when you are looking forward to something with excitement or a positive feeling. For example, you may anticipate a fun vacation, a delicious meal or a concert of your favorite band.

Anticipate is used when you're looking forward to something with excitement and positive feelings, while expect is used when you're looking forward to something with certainty, regardless of your emotional response.

Await.wordDefinition:
Await means to stay or remain in a place until something happens or someone arrives. For example, if you are waiting for your friend at a coffee shop, you are awaiting their arrival.

Await is used more for a physical waiting, while expect is used more for a mental anticipation.

Count on.wordDefinition:
Count on means to rely on something or someone to be there or to do something without fail. For example, "I can count on my friend to always be there for me.".

This word is applicable when you have a strong level of trust or faith in someone or something.

Expect means to anticipate or believe that something will happen or someone will do something. For example, "I expect my friend to arrive on time.".

This word is applicable when you have a certain level of anticipation for a certain outcome, however, it does not imply the same level of certainty or trust as "count on."

In summary, when you count on something or someone, you have complete and unwavering trust in them. When you expect something or someone, you are simply anticipating a specific outcome, but not necessarily certain it will happen.

Look for.wordDefinition:
Expect means to believe or anticipate that something will happen or is likely to happen. For example, you might say, "I expect to receive a good grade on my test because I studied hard.".

Look for means to search or seek something out. For example, you might say, "I am going to look for my phone because I can't find it.".

So, while both words express a level of anticipation, expect is more about a belief or assumption, while look for is more about actively searching for something.

Predict.wordDefinition:
Predict means to say or estimate what will happen in the future, based on observations, data or patterns. For example, a weatherman might predict that it will rain based on radar images, wind direction, and other factors that can be observed and measured.

So, while both words relate to making assumptions about what will happen in the future, expect is grounded in personal experience and intuition, while predict is more scientific and based on data analysis.

Presume.wordDefinition:
Presume means to assume something to be true without having definite proof or evidence. For example, if you presume that someone is lying to you because they are not making eye contact, it means that you assume that they are lying without having any concrete evidence that they are.

Expect is used when we have a reasonable and logical basis for our belief, while presume is used when we are making an assumption without any clear evidence.

Rely on.wordDefinition:
Rely on means to have confidence or trust in someone or something to meet one's needs. Example: "I rely on my alarm clock to wake me up in the morning.".

In essence, expect refers to one's own anticipation or belief about something, while rely on refers to the trust placed on someone or something external to oneself.

Both words are applicable in different contexts, and it's essential to use them correctly to communicate effectively.

Require.wordDefinition:
Require means something is needed or mandatory for something else to happen or be done.

For example, if you need to drive a car, you are required to have a driver's license.

Expect implies anticipation, while require connotes necessity.

quotes.Text: When the people who are responsible for our country ask you a direct question, I expect them to accept a direct answer, not to be blackballed because you are telling the truth.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Eartha Kitt

quotes.Text: One thing they never tell you about child raising is that for the rest of your life, at the drop of a hat, you are expected to know your child's name and how old he or she is.
quotes.Title: American Journalist
quotes.Name: Erma Bombeck

quotes.Text: People - especially white people - they want me to be a role model just because of the life I lead. The things I say in my songs, they expect it of me.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Rihanna

quotes.Text: How wrong it is for a woman to expect the man to build the world she wants, rather than to create it herself.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Anais Nin

quotes.Text: Whenever you hear a man speak of his love for his country, it is a sign that he expects to be paid for it.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: H. L. Mencken

quotes.Text: Expect me to continue what I've been doing, which is trying to take over the world.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Kevin Hart

quotes.Text: My songs are like my children - I expect them to support me when I'm old.
quotes.Title: American Singer
quotes.Name: Dolly Parton

quotes.Text: I was taught to show respect and expect respect given back.
quotes.Title: American Athlete
quotes.Name: Jeff Green

quotes.Text: I never expected that this would be my life.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Kristen Stewart

quotes.Text: I never expected to be anybody important.
quotes.Title: American Singer
quotes.Name: Elvis Presley
